description:
Tasks

Position Overview

Supervise, lead and direct warehouse team assigned to the Inventory Control department. Coordinate daily activities to ensure they are handled in a manner consistent with company service and cost objectives. Secondary responsibilities include coordinating a Quality Control program, managing additional project responsibility as they arise.

Roles & Responsibilities

  • Prioritize daily work schedule for assigned warehouse team and set employee productivity targets
  • Address and resolve inventory area operational, system-related and/or dealership issues
  • Monitor and replenish any supplies and equipment needed in the inventory area
  • Provide coaching to personnel and develop a productive work team
  • Ensure timely updates of daily operation reports and data entry (O/S, Damage, Ocean Log, Productivity Tracking, etc.)
  • Ensure operational training of personnel in the receiving and inventory function
  • Manage the inventory count activities, develop/maintain processes to improve inventory accuracy and ensure adherence to auditor requirements
  • Supervise quality control personnel and maintain parts locations to maximize efficiency of warehouse operations
  • Oversee the pre-pack program to help reduce freight claims
  • Monitor and comply with custom and import requirements
  • Complete annual performance reviews of assigned staff
  • Counsel personnel on performance issues as needed
  • Handle all matters relating to inventory control, checking quality of designated product, ensuring that daily inventory is being performed
  • Analyze and modify parts storage processes, equipment and layout designs to fit current and future business requirements
  • Analyze inventory pick frequencies to modify storage rules or recommend disposition as required
  • Analyze and monitor various transactional activities: (i.e. Air freight lines, Variance report, Item status reports, referral lines report, PO and ETA reports, Claims, etc.)
  • Responsible for maintenance and performance of RF picking devices
  • Open/close facility as required
  • All other duties as assigned

Qualifications

Qualifications

Education

Bachelor’s degree in Business Management or Logistics/Supply Chain preferred or equivalent years of experience

Experience (Job And Industry)

  • 5+ years parts warehouse inventory control experience preferred
  • 5+ years of supervisory skills in a warehouse and/or manufacturing environment
  • Experience in assigning work and effective supervision of staff
  • Knowledge and understanding of computerized parts systems
  • Experience in receiving, inventory and parts return
  • Responsible for the proper usage, awareness, and compliance with IT security policies at PCNA
  • Seeks to ensure proper retention of electronic documents, business confidential information, and actively demonstrates an understanding of the need to safeguard competitive information in both electronic and non-electronic formats
  • Experience with inventory management computer systems, including SAP

Skills

  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Strong PC related skills to include: MS Office, Parts & Warehouse System
  • Solid knowledge of inventory management procedures
  • Knowledge and understanding of computerized parts systems and warehouse management systems (WMS)
  • Ability to operate material handling equipment and RF equipment

Percentage Of Required Travel

Schedule/Shift: M-F 9-5

Physical Requirements

  • Open warehouse environment with variant temperatures
  • Heavy lifting, up to 50 pounds
  • Sitting, lifting, pushing, pulling and extensive standing & walking on concrete surfaces
  • Although a regular 40 hour work schedule will apply to this position, the person selected should be prepared to work flexible work hours that could include weekends and overtime as needed
  • Must be able to effectively work and complete tasks in an open office/noisy environment.

The salary range for this position is between $74,000 and $83,000 annually, commensurate with the candidate's experience.

Direct reports

List by job title any positions to be supervised by the incumbent:

  • Inventory Control Specialist
